page.title: 20HEALTH
page.content: One doctor holds a surgery at a house in Gislingham a few times each week. Other doctors are at Eye or Botesdale Health Centres (4 miles). The nearest hospital is at Eye but only for maternity or geriatric care. Patients needing hospital treatment must go to Ipswich (23 miles), Norwich (25 miles), or Bury St.Edmunds (20 miles). Health care for children includes a monthly clinic held in the Village Hall, home visits by a Health Visitor, immunisation against various diseases, and medical examinations held at school including hearing and eye tests. Most parents arrange dental treatment with a family dentist owing to the infrequency of visits by the Schools' Dental Officer. A District Nurse visits the infirm elderly regularly.
